```{r, echo=FALSE, results='asis', message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(xlsx)
#read in table types
bottles<-read.xlsx("data/New York State Office of Information Technology Services/Sampling Season - Documents/LCI.Field.Season.Intensive.xlsx", 5, header=TRUE)
intensive<-read.xlsx("data/New York State Office of Information Technology Services/Sampling Season - Documents/LCI.Field.Season.Intensive.xlsx", 4, header=TRUE)

#realine the table
library(tidyr)
intensive <- intensive %>% 
  gather(type, sample, Sample1:Sample4)

#merge to create a list of labels
labels<-merge(bottles,intensive,by=c('class','layer'),all=TRUE)
labels<-labels[!is.na(labels$sample),]
labels<-labels[!is.na(labels$Parameter),]
labels<-labels[order(labels$type,labels$sample,labels$Parameter),]

#just printing QA samples
labels<-labels[labels$type=="Sample1",]
labels<-labels[labels$class=="A",]
labels<-labels[labels$layer=="hyp",]
labels<-labels[labels$Parameter=="DOC (pres H2SO4)",]
labels<-labels[order(labels$type,labels$sample,labels$Parameter),]
```


```{r echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
#try this: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36674824/use-loop-to-generate-section-of-text-in-rmarkdown

template1 <- "SampleID: %s\n
Name: %s\n
##     mm/dd/yyyy  hh:mm\n
%s\n
..............................\n
\n" # dont't forget the newline

template2 <- "SampleID: %s\n
Name: %s\n
##    mm/dd/yyyy  hh:mm\n
%s\n
\n" # dont't forget the newline




for (i in seq(nrow(labels))) {
  current <- labels[i, ]
  #use template 2 for every 10 records (includes a line break) and template 1 for all others
  j<-i/10
  if(j%%1==0){
    cat(sprintf(template2, current$sample, current$Lake, current$Parameter))
    }
  
  if(j%%1!=0){
    cat(sprintf(template1, current$sample, current$Lake, current$Parameter))
    }
  }
```
